Paccagū，（adj．-n．） [a difficult word，composed of pacca+ gū，the latter a by-form of °ga，as in paṭṭhagū，vedagū pāragū．pacca may be praṭya，an adv．formn of prep．praṭi，and paṭṭha its doublet．It is not certain whether we should read paṭṭhagū here as well （see paṭṭhagū）．The form may also be expld as a substantivised pl．3rd pret．of praṭi+gacchati=paccaguṁ] “one who goes toward，” a pupil S．I，104 （Mārassa）； vv．ll．baddhabhū，paṭṭhagū．Windisch，Māra & Buddha trsls “unter M’s Herrschaft，” and refers paṭṭhagu to Sk．，pātyagāḥ．Bdhgh （see Kindred Sayings，1，p．319） reads baddhagū and explns by bandhavara sissa antevāsika．（Page 383）
